### PR summary [511a507f3f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18697/commits/511a507f3f94f7545d21825bad678e9ac1d5d1d3)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.Basic | 635 | 636 | +1 (+0.16%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>8 files</summary> `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.Embedding` `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.NCard` `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.Basic` `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Constructions.Cylinders` `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Constructions.SubmoduleQuotient` `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.Prod` `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.CountablyGenerated` `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.PreorderRestrict`</details>|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ae_restrict_le`
`+ condexpKernel_singleton_ae_eq_cond`
`+ condexp_generateFrom_singleton`
`+ condexp_set_generateFrom_singleton`
`+ generateFrom_singleton_le`
`+ measurableSet_generateFrom_singleton_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: kex-y can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11739048099/job/32702770144)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11739048099/job/32702769615)

There is a shorter proof of that in the (closed) PR #16293
Also @YaelDillies wrote over there that we actually don't want that lemma. I'll let them explain why we wouldn't even though several people seem to need it and it seems very natural.

I wasn't able to get the old proof to work so that's why rewrote the proof. Feel free to push a shorter proof if anyone can golf it.

I talked with @YaelDillies already and I think what they meant in that comment is that it was not needed for Violeta and not that it's not useful in general.
Open the namespace `MeasurableSpace` to make that section less verbose?

```suggestion
    [f | MeasurableSpace.generateFrom {s}] =[.restrict s] fun _   x, f x [|s] := by
```
I think it fits? (did not check)
It will definitely fit if you open `MeasurableSpace`.
`hf : Integrable f ` is needed because if `f` is not integrable the lhs is 0 but the rhs might be nonzero because we could have `IntegrableOn f s `, is that right?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: relation between conditional measure and conditional kernel/expectation
